messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Anybody read Hakagure?
messages.msgSnippet: yes i have read the Hagakure behind the leaves and to me it is a good view of the way this samurai thought. He has his his strict way to live and criticises
messages.messageBody:
yes i have read the Hagakure "behind the leaves" and to me it is a good view of the way this samurai thought. He has his his strict way to live and criticises a lot in the way men think of the today (in his time of cause) while he lives like a samurai.
Short passages of his way gives ous a good look of something we cant completly make ourself of because to understand we have to live like him.
hope thats something helps you to your question. More i can tell you about, if i know more precisely what you want to know about!

Lars

samuraionikiller@... wrote:
Has anyone read The Way of the Samurai by Hakagure? I am wanting some, sort
of, reviews, I am aimin' to read it and would like to know more about it, I am
not expecting novel either.



Forgive me if the title is wrong.
